alert.note: Alert for Kershaw; Lee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 9:03PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Lee, northwestern Sumter, east central Richland and south central Kershaw Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 903 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Camden, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Sumter, Camden, Bishopville, Shaw Air Base, Lee State Park, Oakland, Sumter County Airport, Goodale State Park, Ashwood, Dalzell, Dinkins Mill, Manville, Spring Hill, Antioch, Boykin, Fort Jackson McCrady Training Center, Cherryvale, Wateree River Correctional Institution, and Rembert. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 97 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
